turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Four Brothers (band).
turn.1: What was the name of the band Four Brothers?
turn.2: Four Brothers (band) The Four Brothers were perhaps the most internationally successful and recognised group to come from Zimbabwe.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The members were not literally brothers.
turn.6: They played fast-paced guitar-based pop music with songs sung in the Shona language.
turn.7: Did anyone play any other instruments?
turn.8: Their lead guitar string-plucking sound is reminiscent of the sound of the African mbira instrument and is a style known as 'jit'.
turn.10: Founded in Zimbabwe (then Rhodesia) in 1977 by Marshall Munhumumwe and Never Mutare with Edward Matigasi and Aleck Chipaika, the band gained international recognition in the late 1980s with UK BBC Radio 1 DJ John Peel being their most well known advocate.
turn.11: Who was the most successful member?
turn.12: Marshall Munhumumwe was the maternal uncle of Zimbabwean star Thomas Mapfumo.
